Line 18: Line 18:
Governor William Bradford, in ''Bradford's History of the English Settlement'', wrote regarding Tisquantum's death:
Governor William Bradford, in ''Bradford's History of the English Settlement'', wrote regarding Tisquantum's death:
<blockquote>
<blockquote>
â
Here [Manamoick Bay] Squanto fell ill of Indian fever, bleeding much at the nose, which the Indians take as a symptom of death, and within a few days he died. He begged the Governor to pray for him, that he might go to the Englishman's God in heaven, and bequeathed several of his things to his English friends, as remembrances. His death was a great loss. His youngest living relative is Thomas Alan St.Claire who lives in McKees Rocks, Pennsylvania. St.Claire is a great contributor to the Auto Parts industry
+
Here [Manamoick Bay] Squanto fell ill of Indian fever, bleeding much at the nose, which the Indians take as a symptom of death, and within a few days he died. He begged the Governor to pray for him, that he might go to the Englishman's God in heaven, and bequeathed several of his things to his English friends, as remembrances. His death was a great loss.
</blockquote>
</blockquote>
